learning_outcomes.description: Identify a research topic within the field of Museum Studies.
Plan and carry out research within the field of Museum Studies.
Access, evaluate and critique primary and secondary sources.
Develop an argument critically and clearly.
Organise and present written research at a postgraduate level.

assessments.task_description: Students are to submit a 3-5 page thesis outline to the thesis supervisor and the course coordinator, including research question, methodology, key literature, timeframe, and structure.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students are to submit a 3-5 page thesis outline to the thesis supervisor and the course coordinator via email and load via Turnitin on the course Blackboard Ultra. To submit your assessment electronically log in to Blackboard Ultra with your UQ username and password and navigate to the relevant submission link for that assessment item on Blackboard Ultra. No emailed submissions of assessments will be accepted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
To achieve a passing mark in this pass/fail hurdle, students must:

  1. successfully demonstrate understanding in responding to a series (approximately 5) of questions from their thesis supervisor on their project’s progress to date in week 6; and
  2. advise the course coordinator by email (copying in your thesis supervisor) that you have completed this in week 6.

Pending staff confirmation of successful completion of the verbal update with the student’s supervisor, a passing mark can be assigned.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Email the Course Coordinator and your thesis supervisors confirming you have completed the oral review, by the due date and time.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
A thesis of 10,000 - 12,000 words.

Marking criteria and/or marking rubrics are available in the ‘Assessment’ folder in Blackboard Ultra for this course. 

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which AI will provide only limited support and guidance. A failure to reference AI use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. Students must complete an AI usage declaration and submit it with their assessment. Additional resources are available through UQ AI Student Hub.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You must submit your assessment electronically by the due time, on the due date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
How to complete your thesis

This seminar will provide students with an overview of what is expected from a thesis and the process of creating one.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: How to complete your thesis This seminar will provide students with an overview of what is expected from a thesis and the process of creating one.
